title: SOVIET BRUTALIST CAFÉ
description: Concrete dreams and underground scenes. Where Eastern Bloc architecture meets post-punk rebellion. The future was supposed to be built from concrete, and somehow it was beautiful.

post_punk.title: POST-PUNK SPECIALS
post_punk.description: Cold War Cool - Angular rhythms meet concrete aesthetics

concrete_dreams.title: Concrete Dreams
concrete_dreams.description: Brutalist beats for brutalist times. These tracks understand that sometimes the most beautiful music comes from the greyest places.
concrete_dreams.samples: "Love Will Tear Us Apart" by Joy Division, "Blue Monday" by New Order

warsaw_ghetto.title: Warsaw Ghetto
warsaw_ghetto.description: Joy Division's Manchester melancholy meets Eastern European existentialism. When industrial decline becomes industrial music and depression becomes art. These tracks find beauty in the ruins of optimism.
warsaw_ghetto.samples: "Warsaw" by Joy Division, "Leaders of Men" by Joy Division, "Digital" by Joy Division, "Autosuggestion" by Joy Division

factory_records.title: Factory Records Session
factory_records.description: Tony Wilson's Manchester vision with Haçienda heartbeats. When record labels become cultural movements and nightclubs become cathedrals. Music for when commerce and art accidentally create something transcendent.
factory_records.samples: "Ceremony" by New Order, "Procession" by New Order, "Everything's Gone Green" by New Order, "Temptation" by New Order

eastern_bloc.title: EASTERN BLOC ELECTRONICA
eastern_bloc.description: Iron Curtain Innovation - When synths met state socialism

berlin_wall.title: Berlin Wall Sessions
berlin_wall.description: Cold War tension with electronic precision. Kraftwerk meets KGB surveillance in the most beautiful way possible. These tracks understand that the best revolutions happen at 120 BPM.
berlin_wall.samples: "Trans-Europe Express" by Kraftwerk, "Computer World" by Kraftwerk, "The Model" by Kraftwerk, "Autobahn" by Kraftwerk

red_square.title: Red Square Rave
red_square.description: State-sponsored synthesizers with underground spirit. When the party line becomes the party music. These songs capture that beautiful moment when oppression accidentally created the perfect dance floor.
red_square.samples: "Moscow Discow" by Telex, "Rasputin" by Boney M, "Back in the USSR" by The Beatles, "Wind of Change" by Scorpions

checkpoint_charlie.title: Checkpoint Charlie Chillout
checkpoint_charlie.description: Border crossing beats with passport stamping rhythms. Every song sounds like sneaking past guards while looking fabulous. Music for when your rebellion requires proper documentation.
checkpoint_charlie.samples: "Vienna" by Ultravox, "Enola Gay" by Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, "Tainted Love" by Soft Cell, "Don't You (Forget About Me)" by Simple Minds

industrial_revolution.title: INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION 2.0
industrial_revolution.description: Factory Floor Philosophy - When machines make music and music makes revolution

five_year_plan.title: Five Year Plan
five_year_plan.description: Systematic beats for systematic change. Production quotas meet production values in perfect harmony. These tracks understand that the revolution requires both heavy machinery and heavy bass lines.
five_year_plan.samples: "The Man-Machine" by Kraftwerk, "Metal Machine Music" by Lou Reed, "Head Like a Hole" by Nine Inch Nails, "Firestarter" by The Prodigy

assembly_line.title: Assembly Line Anthems
assembly_line.description: Worker solidarity with synthesizer sophistication. Every beat is a hammer blow against capitalism, every melody a wrench in the machine. Music for when your day job is building the future.
assembly_line.samples: "Working Class Hero" by John Lennon, "9 to 5" by Dolly Parton, "Big Brother" by David Bowie, "Power" by Kraftwerk

concrete_jungle.title: Concrete Jungle
concrete_jungle.description: Urban planning meets urban decay in perfect architectural harmony. When tower blocks become concert halls and underpasses become underground scenes. Music for cities built from dreams and cement.
concrete_jungle.samples: "Concrete Jungle" by Bob Marley, "Unknown Pleasures" by Joy Division, "Architecture & Morality" by Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, "Movement" by New Order

underground_resistance.title: UNDERGROUND RESISTANCE
underground_resistance.description: Samizdat Soundtracks - When banned beats become revolutionary anthems

secret_police.title: Secret Police Scanner
secret_police.description: Surveillance state meets underground rave. When your dance moves are politically subversive and your DJ is probably an informant. Music for parties that technically don't exist.
secret_police.samples: "Somebody's Watching Me" by Rockwell, "Every Breath You Take" by The Police, "1984" by David Bowie, "Big Brother" by Stevie Wonder

black_market.title: Black Market Vinyl
black_market.description: Contraband culture with premium production values. When Western music is forbidden fruit and every record is a revolution. These tracks understand that the best art is always banned somewhere.
black_market.samples: "Money for Nothing" by Dire Straits, "Smuggler's Blues" by Glenn Frey, "White Lines" by Grandmaster Flash, "Blue Monday" by New Order

glasnost_disco.title: Glasnost Disco
glasnost_disco.description: Openness meets four-on-the-floor in beautiful transparency. When political reform comes with a disco ball and democratic revolution requires proper footwork. Music for when freedom finally learns to dance.
glasnost_disco.samples: "Wind of Change" by Scorpions, "Freedom" by George Michael, "Right Here, Right Now" by Jesus Jones, "The Final Countdown" by Europe
